history.content: If your linear algebra is strong, with the probability experience you have from 140 you'll be well prepared for 189.

Stat 140 + EECS 127 should be adequate prep for 189.  

However, EECS and LSCS students are still strongly recommended to take EECS 126 instead of Stat 140 (which has to serve a wider audience than 126 does). But if some other reason is forcing the taking of Stat 140 + 150, that should be fine. Not as good, but fine.

From the Stat 140 website:

"Prob 140 is intended to provide good preparation for CS 189 and Stat 154, with the goal that students should be able to move from Prob 140 to a machine learning class without necessarily having to take a semester of theoretical statistics in between."

This seems to go against the overwhelmingly popular narrative that EE126 is the only suitable probability class to take for 189. As a potential CS/Stat double, I feel like 126 would not be the best use of my time since I will have taken Stat 140 (probability theory) and Stat 150 (stochastic processes) for my major anyways. Would there be any notable deficiencies in my understanding, particularly in the realm of topics such as signal processing or communication?
history.subject: Is Stat 140 suitable prep for CS 189?
